solution.text:
TSA of the utensil= TSA of a cylinder - area of the circle cut out + CSA of a cone
CSA of the cone is given by \(\pi \times r \times l\)
\(=\sqrt {h^2+R^2}=\sqrt {h^2+R^2}=\sqrt {_{{3*j}}_^2+_{{4*j}}_^2}=_{{5*j}}_\)
therefore area of a cut out cone=\(\pi \times _{{3*j}}_ \times _{{5*j}}_=_{{trunc(pi_val*j*j*15,2)}}_\)
Now total surface area of a cylinder=\(2 \times \pi \times r \times h + \pi \times r^2 \)
Height of the cube=\(h=_{{4*j}}_\)
Therefore area of the cylinder=\(2 \times \pi \times _{{6*j}}_ \times h + \pi \times _{{6*j}}_^2\)
\(\Rightarrow _{{trunc(2*pi_val*6*j*4*j,2)}}_ + _{{trunc(pi_val*j*j*36,2)}}_=_{{trunc(2*pi_val*6*j*4*j+pi_val*j*j*36,2)}}_\)
area of the cut out circle on the top face=\(\pi \times R^2=_{{trunc(pi_val*j*j*9,2)}}_\)
TSA of the utensil=\(_{{trunc(2*pi_val*6*j*4*j+pi_val*j*j*36,2)}}_ + _{{trunc(pi_val*j*j*15,2)}}_ - _{{trunc(pi_val*j*j*9,2)}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow _{{trunc(2*pi_val*6*j*4*j+pi_val*j*j*36+pi_val*j*j*15-pi_val*j*j*9,2)}}_\)

content.text:
A _{{4*j}}_cm long kulfi maker utensil is made by removing a conical portion out from a cylinder as shown in the figure,
the value of radius(2R) of the cylinder=_{{6*j}}_cm find the surface area of the utensil.(neglect the area of the bottom surface of the cylinder)
